results.content: It's a good course introducing cool stuff. But the author is giving quite too many erratic side comments, does stupid mistakes and constantly types errors. The videos seem to be made with quantity but quality in mind. That's ok, but annoys me.

results.content:
This is a good course. The content and instructor's knowledge are great. My only complaint is that I don't think the instructor has put much consideration into students who are coding along.

I like fast. I typically watch courses at 1.25x, but this one is very rushed. The instructor should slow down a tad and pause for just a moment after typing. (i.e. code disappears from view literally 1 second after he stops typing) The current pace forces even advanced students operate video transports excessively while trying to code along.

Additionally, the instructor's IDE automatically creates some imports. It would be fine if he called out every time it happened, but as is, there's a good chance you will miss imports while following along.

response.content:
Hi! 

Thank you for the honest feedback. I really see what you mean; I definitely need to let the code sit on the screen for a little while before changing tabs/windows/whatever.

I will keep this in mind in my future courses, or any of the videos I re-record here (I would like to go back and improve some of the lectures).

Thanks for the feedback.
response.content_html:

I will keep this in mind in my future courses, or any of the videos I re-record here (I would like to go back and improve some of the lectures).

This is a good course. The content and instructor's knowledge are great. My only complaint is that I don't think the instructor has put much consideration into students who are coding along.

I like fast. I typically watch courses at 1.25x, but this one is very rushed. The instructor should slow down a tad and pause for just a moment after typing. (i.e. code disappears from view literally 1 second after he stops typing) The current pace forces even advanced students operate video transports excessively while trying to code along.

Additionally, the instructor's IDE automatically creates some imports. It would be fine if he called out every time it happened, but as is, there's a good chance you will miss imports while following along.
